text:
Question 23) Three decades - from 1884 to 1914 - separate the nineteenth century - which ended with the race of European countries to Africa and the emergence of national unification movements in Europe - from the twentieth century, which began with World War . It is the period of imperialism, stagnant stillness in Europe and the exciting events in Asia and Africa. ARENDT, H. The origins of totalitarianism. Sao Paulo: Cia. das Letras, 2012.
The historical process cited contributed to the outbreak of the First Great War as
A) spread socialist theories.
B) He intensified the territorial disputes.
C) surpassed the economic crises.
D) multiplied the religious conflicts.
E) Contened the xenophobic feelings.
